title: Forever chemicals PFAS won't be in office supplies from 3M - Inhabitat
summary: 3M announced it will stop making forever chemicals by 2025, addressing the harmful effects of PFAS chemicals found in various products impacting the environment and health, demonstrating a move towards sustainability and environmental responsibility.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as it addresses environmental sustainability goals by discontinuing the production of harmful chemicals impacting ecosystems and human health.
business_innovation: FALSE. The focus is on discontinuing harmful chemicals, which does not fit the definition of a new or improved product or business process.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses the discontinuation of products containing harmful forever chemicals like PFAS, which aligns with the definition of green products by significantly reducing environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. While the article addresses the need for sustainable and environmentally friendly processes to replace harmful chemicals, it does not delve into specific new methods or techniques in operations that minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 325192 - Cyclic Crude, Intermediate, and Gum and Wood Chemical Manufacturing, 325221 - Cellulosic Organic Fiber Manufacturing, 325510 - Paint and Coating Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on 3M's announcement to discontinue harmful chemicals like PFAS, which aligns with addressing environmental concerns rather than misleading claims or deceptive practices.
